panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: ci-runners Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.content:
### Description

This SLI monitors job polling operations from runners, via
Workhorse's `/api/v4/jobs/request` route.

5xx responses are considered to be errors, and could indicate postgres timeouts (after 15s) on the main query
used in assigning jobs to runners.

panels.title: queuing_queries_duration SLI Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="queuing_queries_duration",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="queuing_queries_duration",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="queuing_queries_duration",monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="queuing_queries_duration",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="queuing_queries_duration",monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="queuing_queries_duration",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="queuing_queries_duration",monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="queuing_queries_duration",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="queuing_queries_duration",monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: queuing_queries_duration SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

This SLI monitors the queuing queries duration. Everything above 1
second is considered to be unexpected and needs investigation.

These database queries are executed in the Rails application when a
runner requests a new build to process in `POST /api/v4/jobs/request`.



### Observability Tools

panels.title: shared_runner_queues SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

This SLI monitors the shared runner queues on GitLab.com. Each job is an operation.

Apdex uses queueing latencies for jobs which are considered to be fair-usage (less than 5 concurrently running jobs).

Jobs marked as failing with runner system failures are considered to be in error.

    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="trace_archiving_ci_jobs",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="trace_archiving_ci_jobs",monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

panels.content:

panels.title: loadavg15 per core

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Disk inode utilization per device per node.

If this is too high, its possible that a directory is filling up with
files. Consider logging in an checking temp directories for large numbers
of files
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - (
        node_filesystem_files_free{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}
        /
        node_filesystem_files{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

        1 - node_filesystem_avail_bytes{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} / node_filesystem_size_bytes{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Netfilter connection tracking table utilization per node.

When saturated, new connection attempts (incoming SYN packets) are dropped with no reply, leaving clients to slowly retry (and typically fail again) over the next several seconds.  When packets are being dropped due to this condition, kernel will log the event as: "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet".
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max_over_time(node_nf_conntrack_entries{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}[1m])
      /
      node_nf_conntrack_entries_limit{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nf_conntrack_entries component saturation: conntrack Entries per Node

panels.description:
Measures the amount of scheduler waiting time that processes are waiting
to be scheduled, according to [`CPU Scheduling Metrics`](https://www.robustperception.io/cpu-scheduling-metrics-from-the-node-exporter).

A high value indicates that a node has more processes to be run than CPU time available
to handle them, and may lead to degraded responsiveness and performance from the application.

Additionally, it may indicate that the fleet is under-provisioned.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without (cpu) (rate(node_schedstat_waiting_seconds_total{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}[1h]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: node_schedstat_waiting component saturation: Node Scheduler Waiting Time

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.description:
Private runners utilization per instance.

Each runner manager has a maximum number of runners that it can coordinate at any single moment.

When this metric is saturated, new CI jobs will queue. When this occurs we should consider adding more runner managers,
or scaling the runner managers vertically and increasing their maximum runner capacity.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum without(executor_stage, exported_stage, state) (
        max_over_time(gitlab_runner_jobs{job="runners-manager",shard="private"}[1m])
      )
      /
      gitlab_runner_limit{job="runners-manager",shard="private"} > 0
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: private_runners component saturation: Private Runners utilization

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a shard of a
service fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the
shard needs horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:

  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(

      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

Each runner manager has a maximum number of runners that it can coordinate at any single moment.

 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(

    clamp_max(

        max_over_time(gitlab_runner_jobs{job="runners-manager",shard="shared"}[1m])
      )
      /
      gitlab_runner_concurrent{job="runners-manager",shard="shared"} > 0
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

,0)
